abstract: Federal Communications Commission overcomes Republican opposition to begin exploring subsidizing broadband Internet for poor Americans; plan could eventually introduce sweeping changes to $1.7 billion phone subsidy program.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Communications Commission, in a 3 to 2 vote, approved a plan to explore helping lower-income Americans pay for high-speed Internet access.

headline.main: F.C.C. Will Continue Plan to Subsidize Broadband for the Poor
headline.print_headline: F.C.C. Votes to Move Forward With a Plan to Subsidize Broadband for the Poor

snippet: The Federal Communications Commission, in a 3 to 2 vote, approved a plan to explore helping lower-income Americans pay for high-speed Internet access.
